abstract: 'Id never heard anything like it before and it was the air raid siren.'
description: Evelyn Warner was in London when World War II was declared. As a very young cadet, Warner cycled around the countryside delivering messages. Then one day she had an encounter with a 'doddlebug', an unmanned plane designed to crash and burn, that left her red-faced.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: Compilation title; B2001970; In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [Sale veterans] [June 2010]; Active; 2010
